name: Gallucci v. Ben Avon Borough, Appellant

judges: Before Bell, C. J., Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Keim, JJ.
parties: Gallucci v. Ben Avon Borough, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
The Court being equally divided, the decree is affirmed at the cost of appellant.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Fred G. Houston, Jr., with him Houston é Houston, for appellant.
G. Harold Slcodol, with him Rothman, Gordon and Foreman, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
Gallucci v. Ben Avon Borough, Appellant.
Argued October 9, 1962.
Before Bell, C. J., Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Keim, JJ.
reargument refused April 16, 1963.
Fred G. Houston, Jr., with him Houston é Houston, for appellant.
G. Harold Slcodol, with him Rothman, Gordon and Foreman, for appellees.
March 19, 1963:
